Params: {1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: 'Embla, stop shaking it. Let me take a look...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Liv tries to stop her, but she continues to shake Askr stubbornly.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "I've heard others say that although the bionic machines in the past were programmed with emotions, they were ultimately an imitation.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'They knew to "cry when upset," but they didn\'t know what really constituted "upset."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: '"If someone by your side isn\'t moving, then they must be dead. If someone by your side is dead, then that is worth being upset."', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: '...Even though it was their "choice," they were ultimately following pre-programmed orders...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Mechanoids can only act according to the logic of AI, and AI doesn\'t have the ability to "make its own choices."', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'All their actions are just optimizing predetermined solutions.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Crying when you are sad, for mechanoids, means that all you need to do is cry when you are sad.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'Why be sad? Why cry? These... are the choices that a "soul" makes, not an AI.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Lucia quietly walks up to Embla, who is still shaking Askr.'}
{3: 'Embla keeps shaking Embla, completely ignoring Lucia.'}
{3: 'Lucia reaches out and braces Askr, stopping Embla from shaking him.'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Embla, please stop. This won't solve anything.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Will you let us try if we say we can come up with a way to help?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Embla raises her upper body, turns her head, and looks at all of you silently.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Embla', 3: '"Knowledge." Has no. Answer. If Askr. Doesn\'t. Move...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "We can't guarantee if it will work, but...", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Embla looks up at you all again. After a short pause, she slowly stands up and takes a step back.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lee', 3: "...That doesn't seem to be written in their program. Is it self-evolution?", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Their computational abilities seem to be quite rudimentary... Can this level of AI evolve itself?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "I don't know... Let Liv try to repair Askr first.", 4: '2'}
{3: 'As Liv attempts to repair Askr, Embla stands beside her and stares at Askr, motionless...'}
{3: 'Naturally, there is no emotion in her green "eye," despite it being different from the other mechanoids.'}
{3: '...The look is so different from the one in her eye as she was shaking Askr moments prior.'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'In your opinion, do we look more human? Or machine?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Why are you asking me this all of a sudden?', 3: '78'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "I know that we are the commandant's weapon. Or rather... humanity's weapon.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'The answer is obviousâ€”like a human.', 3: '81', 4: 'More like a machine.', 5: '87', 6: "You're both.", 7: '94'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "...You're right. Regardless of what I am, I am Lucia of the Gray Ravens.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Thank you, Commandant... for giving me a renewed perspective.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Forget it. Let's get back to the task at hand.", 3: '103', 4: 'Lee asked me that, too.', 5: '104'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Knowing you, Commandant, I'd wager that you gave him the same answer.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: '...I see. You are the commandant after all.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Right at that moment, Lee finishes up helping Liv with her repairs and walks over.'}
{3: 'Lee remains quiet. Instead, he just shakes his head.'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: 'We decided to wait for your order.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Embla still stands there, motionless; her posture remains unchanged.'}
{3: 'Liv finishes scanning Askr one more time, then stands up and looks over.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "...There's nothing I can do to repair the mechanoid.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: 'He was suffering from damages along the way, but the last strike has completely destroyed the internal structure...', 4: '1'}
{2: "...There isn't anything else you can do?", 3: '127'}
{3: 'Liv quietly shakes her head, then takes a step back from Askr.'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "...The memory drive that stores its consciousness is still running, but we can't provide a suitable host to transfer it...", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Embla', 3: 'Embla. Can also. Not let Askr get hurt.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Embla', 3: 'Embla. Thought of way. Make Askr. Move.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Embla', 3: 'Not move. Okay. Embla wants. Askr here.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Embla spreads her arms to grasp Askr's head and slowly removes the spherical part."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Embla', 3: 'Askr said. This part. Must not be damaged.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After the core was completely installed into her frame, Embla maintains her posture as she kneels on the ground.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "No... Her frame is normal. She's just not responding. Perhaps...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Liv', 3: "Perhaps, with two consciousnesses in a single frame... they are acclimating to the frame's control.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The rambling Embla trembles for a moment, then raises her head and gazes into the distance.'}
{2: 'Embla?', 3: '... I want. Push everything. Past breaking point. I can. Wake "Father".', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Embla?', 3: '... I want. Push everything. Past breaking point. I can. Wake "Father".', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Embla stands, then stumbles off into the distance.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Liv', 3: "I don't know... but it looks like she's thought of something.", 4: '3'}
{2: 'Lee', 3: "She's repeating what Askr said... Is she doing what Askr originally wanted to do?", 4: '2'}
{2: "Right. It's not like we have any other choice."}
